description:
Representing policyholders only from our law office in Pensacola, Florida, the attorneys at Taylor, Warren, Weidner & Hancock, P.A., are fully committed to helping you resolve your conflicts with insurance companies so that you can obtain the full amount of compensation you deserve for your personal injury, insurance, and disability claims.

Serving clients throughout Bay County, Panama City and all of the surrounding areas of Florida panhandle, each of our law firm's attorneys has achieved unprecedented success advocating on behalf of policyholders when insurance companies try to delay, deny, or underpay their claim. To date, we have recovered millions of dollars in total compensation for our clients, earning our memberships into the Million and Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forums.

In addition, our attorneys hold AV Preeminent peer review ratings* from Martindale-Hubbell, and we have earned numerous other awards and honors for our impeccable professionalism and service, so you know that you can trust us with your most sensitive legal issues while receiving the highest level of advocacy and support you deserve.

We understand that insurance companies are only looking out for their best interests, not yours. Through our years of experience standing up to these major corporations, we have developed the invaluable skills necessary to hold them accountable for the benefits they promise to their policy holders.

If you suffered an injury in an accident caused by someone else or if your insurance company denied your property damage claim, you can begin the process of securing the finances you need to cover your damages by contacting Taylor, Warren, Weidner & Hancock, P.A. We never charge any fee or cost to evaluate your case and advise you of your rights. We handle the majority of our insurance cases on a contingency fee, which means you only have to pay us if you recover from the insurance company.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
